serial Class Reference

Detailed Description

Used to manipulate a serial connection in Linux for connecting, reading, and writing.

Richard Edwards

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

serial::serial ( int  baudrate,
int  block_read 
)

Constructs a general serial class. However, the only specifiable parameter for the serial is the baudrate. At a later date, the class will be update to support a wider range of serial connections.

Parameters:
baudrate - The communication speed.
block_read - specifies whether or not _read should block

Member Function Documentation

int serial::connect ( const char *  device  ) 

Used to connect to a specified device, and configure the serial channel. The channel is currently only configurable as 8N1.

void serial::disconnect (  ) 

Used to close the serial connction.

int serial::_write ( unsigned char *  buf,
int  bytes 
)

Parameters:
buf - buffer that contains the data to be written.
bytes - the number of bytes to write.
Returns:
The number of bytes written.

int serial::_read ( unsigned char *  buf,
int  bytes 
)

Used to read data off of a serial connection, note that if the serial connection is configured to be non-blocking, you may not read the desired number of bytes.

Parameters:
buf - buffer for storing the read data.
bytes - the number of bytes to be read.
Returns:
The number of bytes read.

void serial::flush_input (  ) 

Flushes the serial input buffer.

void serial::flush_output (  ) 

Flushes the serial output buffer.
